member.name: T:LibLAS.LASReader

member.name: M:LibLAS.LASReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a LASReaderH object that can be used to read LASHeaderH and LASPointH objects with.
member.remarks: The LASReaderH must not be created with a filename that is opened for read or write by any other API functions.
member.param: filename to open for read

member.summary: Reads the next available point on the LASReaderH instance.
member.returns: true if we have next point

member.summary: get the current LASPoint.

member.name: M:LibLAS.LASReader.GetPointAt(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Reads a LASPointH from the given position in the LAS file represented by the LASReader instance.
member.remarks: If no point is available at that location, NULL is returned.
member.param: the integer position of the point in the file to read.

member.summary: Get the header for the file associated with this Reader Class.
member.returns: LASHeader representing the header for the file.

member.name: M:LibLAS.LASHeader.AddVariableLengthRecord(LibLAS.LASVariableLengthRecord)
member.summary: Adds a variable length record instance to the header.
member.param: variable Length record instance to add

member.name: M:LibLAS.LASHeader.GetVariableLengthRecord(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns the variable length record for the given index.
member.param: the index starting from 0 of the variable length record to fetch
member.returns: a new variable length record instance
member.remarks: Use VariableLengthRecordsCount property to determine the number of variable length records available on the header.

member.name: M:LibLAS.LASHeader.DeleteVariableLengthRecord(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Deletes a variable length record from the header for the given index.
member.param: the index starting from 0 of the variable length record to delete

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.FileSignature
member.summary: Get ASPRS LAS file signature.
member.remarks: The only value allowed as file signature is "LASF",

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.FileSourceId
member.summary: file source identifier.
member.remarks: should be set to a value between 1 and 65535.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.Reserved
member.summary: Get value field reserved by the ASPRS LAS Specification.
member.remarks: This field is always filled with 0.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.ProjectId
member.summary: Get project identifier.
member.remarks: return Global Unique Identifier.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.VersionMajor
member.summary: major component of version of LAS format.
member.remarks: Always 1 as the only valid value. value between eVersionMajorMin and eVersionMajorMax (always 1).

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.VersionMinor
member.summary: minor component of version of LAS format.
member.remarks: Valid values are 1 or 0. value between eVersionMinorMin and eVersionMinorMax.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.SystemId
member.summary: system identifier
member.remarks: Default value is "libLAS" specified as the SystemIdentifier constant. string is padded right with spaces and its length is 32 bytes.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.SoftwareId
member.summary: software identifier
member.remarks: Default value is "libLAS 1.0", specified as the SoftwareIdentifier constant. String is padded right with spaces and its length is 32 bytes.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.CreationDOY
member.summary: day of year of file creation date.
member.remarks: Use full date structure instead of Julian date number. value is lower than number 366.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.CreationYear
member.summary: year of file creation date.
member.remarks: value is lower than number 9999.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.HeaderSize
member.summary: number of bytes of generic verion of public header block storage.
member.remarks: Standard version of the public header block is 227 bytes long.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.DataOffset
member.summary: number of bytes from the beginning to the first point record.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.VariableLengthRecordsCount
member.summary: Returns the number of variable length records in the header

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.DataFormatId
member.summary: the data format id for the file.
member.remarks: The value should be 1 or 0, with 1 being points that contain time values and 0 being points that do not.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.DataRecordLength
member.summary: return the record length for the points based on their data format id in bytes.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.PointRecordsCount
member.summary: number of point records in the file.
member.remarks: This value may not reflect the actual number of point records in the file.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.GUID
member.summary: GUID value for the header.
member.remarks: sets and gets the LASGuid instance of the header.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASHeader.Proj4
member.summary: sets and gets the Proj4 in the header.

members.member: Minimum of major component
Maximum of major component
Minimum of minor component
Maximum of minor component
Versions of point record format.
Point Data Format \e 0
Point Data Format \e 1
Number of bytes of point record storage in particular format.
Size of point record in data format \e 0
Size of point record in data format \e 1

members.member:
Returns the version string for this library. @return the version string for this library.
If libLAS is built using solution from trunk/build/msvc80/liblas.sln then C API DLL is called liblas_c_dll.dll, so value of the constant below should be updated to "liblas_c_dll.dll".
Resets the error stack for the libLAS C API.
Pops the top error off of the error stack for the libLAS C API.
Returns the error number of the last error on the error stack. @return the error number of the last error on the error stack.
Returns the name of the method the last error message happened in. @return the name of the method the last error message happened in.
Returns the name of the method the last error message happened in. @return the name of the method the last error message happened in.
Returns the number of error messages on the error stack. @return the number of error messages on the error stack.

Prints the last error message in the error stack to stderr. If there is no error on the error stack, only the message is printed. The function does not alter the error stack in any way. @param message Message to include in the stderr output

Reads the next available point on the LASReaderH instance. If no point is available to read, NULL is returned. If an error happens during the reading of the next available point, an error will be added to the error stack and can be returned with the LASError_GetLastError* methods. @param hReader the opaque handle to the LASReaderH @return an opaque handle to a LASPointH object, or NULL if no point is available to read or an error occured. Use the LASError_GetLastError* methods to confirm the existence of an error if NULL is returned.

Reads a LASPointH from the given position in the LAS file represented by the LASReaderH instance. If no point is available at that location, NULL is returned. If an error happens during the reading of the point, an error will be added to the error stack and can be returned with the LASError_GetLastError* methods. @param hReader the opaque handle to the LASReaderH @param position the integer position of the point in the file to read. @return an opaque handle to a LASPointH object, or NULL if no point is available at the given location or an error occured. Use the LASError_GetLastError* methods to confirm the existence of an error if NULL is returned.
Closes the file for reading operations represented by the LASReaderH instance. @param hReader the opqaue handle to the LASReaderH

Returns the return number for the point. The return number is "the pulse return number for a given output pulse." The first return number starts with the value 1. @param hPoint LASPointH instance @return a return number, valid from 1-6, for the point. Use the LASError methods to determine if an error occurred during this operation if 0 is returned.

Returns a bitfield representing the validity of various members * enum DataMemberFlag { eReturnNumber = 1, eNumberOfReturns = 2, eScanDirection = 4, eFlightLineEdge = 8, eClassification = 16, eScanAngleRank = 32, eTime = 64 }; * @param hPoint LASPointH instance * @return bitfield representing the validity of various members.
Destroys/deletes a LASPointH instance
Creates an empty LASHeaderH with default values
Destroys/deletes a LASHeader instance
Returns the project id for the header as a GUID string @return the project id for the header as a GUID string
Returns the System ID for the header. The caller assumes ownership of the returned string @return the system id for the header as a character array
Returns the Software ID for the header. The caller assumes ownership of the returned string @return the software id for the header as a character array
Returns the reserved value for the header. This should aways be 0. @return the reserved value for the header.
Returns the size of the header for the file in bytes. @return the size of the header for the file in bytes.
Returns a new random GUID. @return a new random GUID
Destroys a GUID opaque pointer and removes it from the heap @param hId the GUID value to destroy as an opaque LASGuidH pointer.
Creates a new VLR record @return a new VLR record
Destroys a VLR record and removes it from the heap

member.name: T:LibLAS.LASPoint
member.summary: LASPoint class

member.summary: Create a new LASPoint from the LASPointH opaque structure
member.param: LASPointH opaque structure

member.name: M:LibLAS.LASPoint.#ctor
member.summary: Create a generic LASPoint

member.name: M:LibLAS.LASPoint.Equals(LibLAS.LASPoint)
member.summary: Compare 2 LASPoint to be equal
member.param: LASPoint object
member.returns: true if lasPoint is equals to the instance.

member.name: M:LibLAS.LASPoint.IsValid
member.summary: test is the LASPoint is Valid

member.name: M:LibLAS.LASPoint.Dispose
member.summary: The object user should call this method when they finished with the object. In .NET is magaged by the GC.

member.name: M:LibLAS.LASPoint.GetPointer
member.summary: gets the opaque pointer to the LASPointH instance.
member.returns: the opaque pointer to the LASPointH instance

member.name: M:LibLAS.LASPoint.Copy
member.summary: Copy a LASPoint object creating a new one.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.X
member.summary: X value for the point.
member.remarks: This value must be scaled or offset by any header values before being set.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.Y
member.summary: Y value for the point.
member.remarks: This value must be scaled or offset by any header values before being set.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.Z
member.summary: Z value for the point.
member.remarks: This value must be scaled or offset by any header values before being set.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.Intensity
member.summary: intensity value for the point.
member.remarks: This value is the pulse return magnitude, it is optional, and it is LiDAR system specific.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.ScanFlags
member.summary: scan flags for the point -- Return number, number of returns, flightline edge, scan direction, and scan angle rank.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.ReturnNumber
member.summary: return number for the point.
member.remarks: The return number is "the pulse return number for a given output pulse." The first return number starts with the value 1. valid from 1 to 6.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.NumberOfReturns
member.summary: total number of returns for a given pulse.
member.remarks: Valid values are from 1-5.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.ScanDirection
member.summary: scan direction for a given pulse.
member.remarks: Valid values are 0 or 1, with 1 being a positive scan direction and 0 being a negative scan direction.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.FlightLineEdge
member.summary: whether or not a given pulse is an edge point.
member.remarks: Valid values are 0 or 1, with 1 being an edge point and 0 being interior.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.Classification
member.summary: classification for the point.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.ScanAngleRank
member.summary: the scan angle for the point.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.UserData
member.summary: arbitrary user data for the point.

member.name: P:LibLAS.LASPoint.Time
member.summary: time for the point.

member.name: T:LibLAS.LASPoint.DataMemberFlag
member.summary: Returns a bitfield representing the validity of various members.
